Once upon a time, there was a boy named Kyle.
He was only a year old, and he was quite small for his age, with pale skin, large brown eyes, and curly red hair.
He was currently wearing a pink onesie; his parents strongly believed in busting stereotypes, and they thought that dressing their boy in pink was a good step in that direction.

Right now, Kyle was sitting on the beige rug in the living room, right next to a red satin couch, upon which sat his mother Shannon, who also had red hair, but hers was straight and in a ponytail. She had eyes like her son's but was wearing glasses and was wearing a white T-shirt and grey sweatpants. Her appearance could be described as "dumpy", very short but quite heavy. She also had pale skin.

Kyle's father Francis was present too, standing up and looking down at Kyle. His hair was curly like his son's, but it was dark brown, and he had small blue eyes.
Francis was wearing a blue shirt and green shorts, and he was thin like his son and of average height. His skin was fair, but pinker than his wife and son's.

Kyle was the only child of Francis and Shannon, and they loved him dearly.
He reached out his hand and grabbed the armrest.
"That's it, Kyle!" said Francis.
Then, Kyle began walking along awkwardly, holding onto the side of the couch.
When he reached the end, he fell over backwards.
"You'll get the hang of it sometime," said Shannon.

What happens now?

One Saturday morning, a family were sitting at the table, eating breakfast.

On one end of the table sat Darlene, the mother, a thin woman of average height with a blonde ponytail and large blue eyes. She was wearing a black dress and a pink cardigan.

On the other end sat Tony, the father, a tall, pudgy man with small hazel eyes and curly brown hair. He was wearing an orange shirt and black jeans.

On one side of the table sat Darlene and Tony's two oldest children: Veronica who was eleven and and had blonde pigtails, was a bit short for her age, and was wearing a lacy blue dress with buttons all down the front, and Gabe who was eight and of average size for his age, and had straight brown hair, glasses, a neon green T-shirt and navy blue shorts.

And on the opposite side from Veronica and Gabe was Elise; the youngest child. She was wearing a red frilly dress and had curly brown hair like her father's, tied up with a red bow.
All the children had eyes like their father's, except Elise who had eyes like her mother's.

"Guess what?!" said Darlene.
"What?!" said everyone else, except Elise who kept drinking milk from her sippy cup.
"My parents Grandpa Stephen and Grandma Alana are coming to visit this afternoon!"
The children cheered, for they really enjoyed their grandparents' visits.

info.brief_description: Because there's already a story about potty training on this website, so why not?
info.description:
Hi! So, I was inspired to write this story because I was browsing the website and I saw that there was a story about potty training. I thought that it was kind of funny how there was a whole story just about kids learning a basic skill and I thought, "It's not like there's any stories about kids learning other basic skills" and then I thought, "Hey, I could write one!".

Rules:

1.) Some unrelated things can happen to keep the story interesting, but the main focus should be on the kids learning basic skills.
2.) No time skips that last a year or more.
3.) A bit of toilet humour is fine, as long as it doesn't go overboard.
4.) No nausea/throwing up/etc or sleep deprivation. I just don't like those topics. Also, nobody should get sick. Minor injuries are fine but no serious injuries. Disabilities are fine as long as they've always been present (e.g. introducing a character who's blind is find but it's less fine to have a character go blind.)
5.) No racism/sexism/homophobia/etc unless it's an antagonist who believes those things or a kid learning about how stereotyping is wrong. This includes things like "dolls are for girls" and stuff like that.
6.) Romance between adults or kids playing at things like getting married is fine, but no explicit sexual stuff. Pregnancy is OK as long as it's an adult. Nudity is fine as long as it's in a *non-sexual* context. And absolutely *no* incest, pedophilia, adultery or bestiality.
7.) No serious topics like divorce, substance abuse, death, psychological problems, etc.
8.) If a character disappears or transforms, they have to go back to normal.

Other than that, have fun.
